cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NW of Great Inagua Island and about 340 mi SE of Nassau
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest while skirting just offshore the Florida east coast and then toward the coasts of South and North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South-North Carolina border region (near Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Atlantic coast north of Sebastian Inlet through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40–50 mph) possible Sunday evening into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized higher totals; mainly heavy squalls Sunday night–Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents that could halt cargo operations and pilot transfers.
